Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class defines the structure of the Webale Chess Board. Generally, the Board constitutes of 56 Squares, where Pieces of each square (if applicable) is defined by a Player's pieceList.

    • Method Detail

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Initializes all the squares in the squareList, setting each to empty(unoccupied) status

      • startingArrangement

        public void startingArrangement()
        Arranges the pieces to the standard Webale Chess' starting position

      • loadArrangement

        public void loadArrangement(Piece p,
                            int row,
                            int col)
        Loads a piece's arrangment into the board. This method is used for setting up pieces in load games. Player's pieces are individually checked beforehand by calling class and its location in the board is passed.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to be added to board
        row - Row location (y-axis) of piece
        col - Column location (x-axis) of piece

        Returns:

      • isClearPathway

        public boolean isClearPathway(Square start,
                              Square end)
        To check if triangle/plus pieces have clear pathways from their starting position until end position
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to be checked for its type
        start - Starting square
        end - Destination square
        Returns:
        true if pathway from start to end is clear from any piece
